sentences.cn: “她有些古怪。”——“为什么这么说呢？”

sentences.en: A really weird thing happened last night.
sentences.cn: 昨晚发生了一件非常奇怪的事。

sentences.en: Bizarre thoughts, weird visions, and strange voices perplexed and terrified her.
sentences.cn: 数不尽的离奇念头, 光怪陆离的幻象, 奇异的声响,一齐向她袭来,使她感到恐惧.

sentences.en: Driving through England in the blackout was a weird experience.
sentences.cn: 在灯火管制时期驱车于英格兰大地,简直是不可思议的事情.

sentences.en: Drugs can make you do all kinds of weird things.
sentences.cn: 毒品可以让你做出各种各样奇怪的事情。

sentences.en: From his weird behaviour, he seems a bit of an oddity.
sentences.cn: 从他不寻常的行为看来, 他好像有点怪.

sentences.en: He looks like nothing on earth in those weird clothes.
sentences.cn: 他穿着奇装异服难看极了.

sentences.en: His weird clothes really gas me.
sentences.cn: 他的怪衣裳简直笑死人.

sentences.en: It felt weird going back to Liverpool.
sentences.cn: 回到利物浦后，感觉很奇怪。

sentences.en: It was a weird old house , full of creaks and groans.
sentences.cn: 这是所神秘而可怕的旧宅,到处嘎吱嘎吱作响.

sentences.en: That wacko talks to himself in a weird language.
sentences.cn: 那个怪人用一种奇怪的语言自言自语.

sentences.en: The altered landscape looks unnatural and weird.
sentences.cn: 改造后的景观看起来很不自然，极其怪异。

sentences.en: The weird figures of the etching haunted my fitful sleep.
sentences.cn: 那幅版画上鬼怪似的人物形象在我辗转反侧的半睡眠中忽隐忽现.

sentences.en: They sell all sorts of weird and wonderful (= very strange ) products.
sentences.cn: 他们出售各种稀奇古怪的产品。

trans.tran_cn: 奇怪的，不寻常的，诡异的
trans.tran_en: very strange and unusual, and difficult to understand or explain
